title: I have dozens of vinyl records that I don't want and can't seem to sell. They don't have the containers and they're slightly scratched. What should I do with them? - Quora

response.answer_text: What do you mean by containers? The record cover or the record sleeve? The cover is the cardboard with cover art and the sleeve is the paper, plastic, or paper/plastic sleeve the record goes into before going in to the cover. Records are not usually salable or have a small fraction of the value without the cover. The records would be only be salable without a cover if it’s a VERY RARE record that’s desirable. They’re sellable without the sleeve if they were desirable records but it would be a lot of work to sell them. You probably should sell them to a used record dealer or donate them to Goodwill.

I have dozens of vinyl records that I don't want and can't seem to sell. They don't have the containers and they're slightly scratched. What should I do with them? Give them away, put an ad out suggesting free albums for art projects like gluing them to a wall or melting them into bowls for decorative use.
